result.markdown:
--- title: "Data Acquisition" author: "Franziska Nissen" --- # Challenge 2.1 For the first challenge I looked up the weather in Moliets-et-Maa since this is one of my vacation destinations for this summer. ::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_53b3063b3d44d7564703a4ebc1beecea'} ```{.r .cell-code} # 1.0 LIBRARIES ---- library(tidyverse) # Main Package - Loads dplyr, purrr, etc. library(rvest) # HTML Hacking & Web Scraping library(xopen) # Quickly opening URLs library(jsonlite) # converts JSON files to R objects library(glue) # concatenate strings library(stringi) # character string/text processing library(lubridate) # Moliets' weather forecast for the next 16 days (21.05.2023) ---- weather_moliets <- "https://www.wetter.com/wetter_aktuell/wettervorhersage/16_tagesvorhersage/frankreich/moliets-et-maa/FR2993520.html" html_weather <- weather_moliets %>% read_html() # The first week had another node than the last days, so I had to extract them two different ways and eventually add them back together date_8to16 <- html_weather %>% html_nodes(".no-hover .date")%>% html_text() %>% stringr::str_extract("\\w+[:space:]\\d+\\.\\d+\\.") date_8to16 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "SO 28.05." "MO 29.05." "DI 30.05." "MI 31.05." "DO 01.06." "FR 02.06." #> [7] "SA 03.06." "SO 04.06." "MO 05.06." ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} date_merged <- html_weather %>% html_nodes(".bg--blue-gradient .date") %>% # these are only the first 7 days html_text() %>% c(date_8to16) # so I added the last 11 days date_merged ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "SO 21.05." "MO 22.05." "DI 23.05." "MI 24.05." "DO 25.05." "FR 26.05." #> [7] "SA 27.05." "SO 28.05." "MO 29.05." "DI 30.05." "MI 31.05." "DO 01.06." #> [13] "FR 02.06." "SA 03.06." "SO 04.06." "MO 05.06." ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} weekday <- date_merged %>% stringr::str_extract("\\w+") # removes the date weekday ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "SO" "MO" "DI" "MI" "DO" "FR" "SA" "SO" "MO" "DI" "MI" "DO" "FR" "SA" "SO" #> [16] "MO" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Create a year vector, so I can add it to the date (dd.mm.) to turn it into the date format year <- c("2023","2023","2023","2023","2023", "2023","2023","2023","2023","2023", "2023","2023","2023","2023","2023","2023") # I didn't know how to make it pretty date <- date_merged %>% stringr::str_extract("\\d+\\.\\d+\\.") %>% # extracting the weekday paste(year) %>% stringr::str_remove("[:space:]") %>% # removing the space dmy() # That is the final date date ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "2023-05-21" "2023-05-22" "2023-05-23" "2023-05-24" "2023-05-25" #> [6] "2023-05-26" "2023-05-27" "2023-05-28" "2023-05-29" "2023-05-30" #> [11] "2023-05-31" "2023-06-01" "2023-06-02" "2023-06-03" "2023-06-04" #> [16] "2023-06-05" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} max_temp <- html_weather %>% html_nodes(".temp-max") %>% html_text() max_temp ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "19°" "18°" "19°" "20°" "20°" "22°" "18°" "19°" "19°" "19°" "19°" "19°" #> [13] "20°" "20°" "20°" "21°" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} min_temp <- html_weather %>% html_nodes(".temp-min") %>% html_text() %>% stringr::str_extract("\\d+°") # removes the space and "/" min_temp ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "12°" "15°" "15°" "15°" "16°" "16°" "14°" "16°" "17°" "16°" "15°" "15°" #> [13] "16°" "16°" "17°" "17°" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} weather_state <- html_weather %>% html_nodes(".weather-state") %>% html_text() %>% stringr::str_extract("\\w+[:space:]\\w+|\\w+") # wasn't pretty w/o the extraction weather_state ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] "überwiegend trocken" "bedeckt" "überwiegend trocken" #> [4] "wolkig" "sonnig" "leicht bewölkt" #> [7] "sonnig" "sonnig" "sonnig" #> [10] "sonnig" "Regen" "Regen" #> [13] "Regen" "bedeckt" "Regen" #> [16] "Regen" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # The final tibble Weather_tbl_joined <- tibble(date, weekday, max_temp, min_temp, weather_state) Weather_tbl_joined ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: :::
